document



class DOCUMENT: gsv.SourceView.SourceView;
Testing Documentation DOCUMENT is basically SourceView with a couple of personal tweaks

@property bool Modified();
Has buffer been modified since last save. (or instantiation)

@property string Name();
@property void Name(string NewName);
Fully qualified path name of this objects file

@property string ShortName();
Basically a name to put in the page tab

@property bool Virgin();
Indicates if this object has an actual file associated with it

@property int LineNumber();
Returns current line number

string Symbol();
Returns fully scoped symbol currently under cursor if any.

string Symbol(ref TextIter BeginsAt);
Returns fully scoped symbol currently under cursor if any. Also returns TextIter at beginning of symbol.

string Symbol(TextIter AtIter, ref TextIter BeginsAtIter);
Returns fully scoped symbol at AtIter. And where that symbols begins is returned in BeginsAtIter

@property string Word();
returns the word currently at the insert mark (cursor) May have to spice this up a little to reflect a programming environment

@property string WordAtPopUpMenu();
Word property wasn't up for this So here is WordAtPopUpMenu easy to implement for when mouse popups the window easy for when keyboard popups the window problem to do it for both hopefully It works the way I think it does. Any errors look here.

@property string Selection();
Returns any selected text

void Engage();
Basically connects signals. Not done in constructor to ensure all objects (meaning Config for now) have actually been created and exist.

void Disengage();
Not sure if I actually need this. Intended to reverse anything done in Engage.

static DOCUMENT Create(string title);
Returns a new virgin DOCUMENT Empty of text and ready to go. Title will determine file type.

static DOCUMENT Open(string FileName, ulong LineNo = 1);
Returns a new DOCUMENT associated with FileName. Definitely not a virgin. Even if FileName is empty.

bool Close(bool Quitting = false);
Confirms closing a modified file. Possibly saves before returning the result. Caller is responsible for anything else. Such as freeing resources.

void Save();
Writes buffer to mName. Throws an exception if it fails.

void SaveAs(string NewName);
Changes mName and calls Save()

void GotoLine(ulong Line);
Moves cursor (insert mark) to Line. Watch out for off by one errors. At least 'til I check it out.

void Edit(string Verb);
Performs the usual edit actions on the DOCUMENT. Verb can be "UNDO", "REDO", "CUT", "COPY", "PASTE", or "DELETE"
